text.text: What are the different ways to verify that a claim was submitted to the clearinghouse?

text: You can verify that a claim was submitted to the clearinghouse by checking the claim status, audit trail, and billing lifecycle tab. You can also manually verify that the clearinghouse received the claim.

text.text: launch me to claim batches page
What are the different ways to verify that a claim was submitted to the clearinghouse?

text: You can verify that a claim was submitted to the clearinghouse by checking the: Claim page, Claim Batches page, Claim Submissions page. You can also manually verify that the clearinghouse received the claim.

text.text: How can I tell if a claim has been submitted by checking the Claim page?

text: You can tell if a claim has been submitted by checking the Claim page's: Claim status changes: The status changes to "Submitted". Submission history tab: Displays the submission date and the payer. Batch#: Displays the batch details including the processing information and the claim numbers of all claims in the batch. Submission data: Displays the submission file in a readable format, the CLP file, and charges on the claim. Billing lifecycle tab: Displays all the statuses the claim has gone through including the queued and submitted dates.

text.text: What information is displayed on the Submission History tab of the Claim page?

text: The Submission History tab displays the submission date and the payer. The Batch# displays the batch details including the processing information and the claim numbers of all claims in the batch. The Submission data displays the submission file in a readable format, the CLP file, and charges on the claim.

text.text: Where can I find the batch details for a submitted claim?

text: You can find the batch details for a submitted claim by clicking the "Audit trail" tab on the Claim page. You will see an entry under the Details column that says "Submitted to clearinghouse batch #XXXXXX, file XXXXXXX". You can also find the batch details by clicking the "Claim Batches" link in that message.

text.text: What does the "Receipt verified" column indicate on the Claim Batches page?

text: The "Receipt verified" column on the Claim Batches page indicates whether the clearinghouse received the claim. If a message was received from the clearinghouse, this column displays "Verified by clearinghouse". If no message was received, "Not verified" displays and a "Verify receipt" button displays in the last column.

text.text: If no message was received from the clearinghouse, what will be displayed in the "Receipt verified" column?

text: If no message was received from the clearinghouse, the "Receipt verified" column will display "Not verified" and a "Verify receipt" button will display in the last column.

text.text: How can I manually verify that the clearinghouse received a claim?

text: After you manually verify that the clearinghouse received the claim, click Verify receipt. "Verify manually" displays in the "Receipt verified' column. If the verification was a mistake, click the 'x' next to "Verify manually" and the line will change back to "Verify receipt".

text.text: What options are available if I accidentally verify receipt manually and need to undo it?

text: If you accidentally verify receipt manually, you can click the 'x' next to "Verify manually" and the line will change back to "Verify receipt".

text.text: Where can I find a list of claims with queued or submitted status on the Claim Submissions page?

text: You can find a list of claims with queued or submitted status on the Claim Submissions page. You can click the claim number to go to the Claim page.
